Q44: Unfortunately, I find my MindScape journal prompts to have less depth and lower quality than my normal journals, for two main reasons: first, the length is limited to 500 characters, so while that makes it much easier to complete a journal each night, my thoughts are concurrently more limited. Second, I find a lot of the prompts to not really reflect my day-to-day experience. This is because the app tends to see trends or differences in my behavior when there isn't a particular cause behind them. For example, I've gotten a few questions about why I think my texting or calling behavior has changed, and I can only reply that it's because of natural fluctuations. I didn't purposely change that behavior, and when viewed over a longer span of time the behavior isn't really changing. It's just in one day I happened to get a call from my mom and a friend, and the other day I didn't. Also, the location data isn't entirely accurate, so sometimes the app will think I'm in my dorm when really I'm in my house's kitchen, or that I'm in a friend's dorm when really I'm at the climbing gym. It's hard to resolve those issues for sure, but it ends up generating prompts that don't really apply to what my daily experience was.
Q45: There was one prompt that really resonated with me, and it was about changes to my walking routine. The app couldn't have recognized this, but I've recently started a meditative practice when I'm walking from class to class. About a week or two after I started it, I got a question from the app about my walking routine, and it gave me an opportunity to reflect on how the meditative practice had been going!
